snp4.1:5.3: Bodhi, Norman, and Ñāṇadīpa all have “enter” here, while Thanissaro has “invades”. But this is a stock line, and it’s hard to read _anveti_ as anything other than “follows”. Niddesa (mnd1:70.2) has _anveti anugacchati anvāyikaṁ hoti_. The metaphor is not that water “enters” him, but that a leaky boat contains water and takes it with them (like a shadow or an ox-cart). That’s why they have to bale it out in the next verse.
